title: Daily Market Digest: February 17, 2026
subtitle: Global markets navigate AI disruption fears and economic data releases

items.headline: Global Markets Face Mixed Session Amid AI Concerns and Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Today, February 17, 2026, global markets experienced a mixed trading session. While US equity futures showed signs of recovery after initial declines, extending last week's selloff driven by artificial intelligence (AI) disruption concerns, Asian markets saw subdued volumes due to Lunar New Year holidays. Indian benchmarks erased early losses, with IT stocks leading gains. The overarching sentiment remains cautious, with investors keenly watching economic data and geopolitical developments. Not financial advice.

items.statContext: Down 0.41% for the day; futures initially dropped 0.5% but later gained 0.2%
Nasdaq 100 futures initially dropped 0.9% but later rose 0.01%; Composite down 0.22% on Friday

items.headline: Infosys Leads Indian Market Gains
items.summary: Infosys Ltd. surged due to positive sectoral trends and favorable market sentiment.

items.headline: ITC Rises on Price Hike Expectations
items.summary: ITC Ltd. advanced after reports of price hikes in some categories, attracting investor interest.

items.headline: Kwality Wall's Slides in Early Trade
items.summary: Kwality Wall's (India) was among the biggest losers in the Indian market's opening session.

items.headline: Hindalco Industries Down as Metal Stocks Drag
items.summary: Hindalco Industries saw declines as metal stocks broadly weighed on the market.

items.headline: AI Disruption Fears Continue to Impact High-Valuation Sectors
items.summary: Concerns over increasingly sophisticated AI tools, such as Anthropic PBC's Claude Cowork, are intensifying fears of structural pressure on traditional software business models. This has contributed to a risk-averse sentiment and sell-offs across US equities, particularly in technology and communication services sectors.

items.headline: Value Outperforms Growth as Sector Rotation Intensifies
items.summary: Sector rotation is intensifying, with value stocks outperforming growth. Cyclical sectors like Energy ($XLE), Materials ($XLB), and Industrials ($XLI) are leading, alongside Consumer Staples ($XLP) and Healthcare ($XLV), as investors seek stability. Conversely, Technology ($XLK), Communication Services ($XLC), and Financials ($XLF) are lagging.

items.headline: Key US Economic Data and Fed Speeches on Today's Docket
items.summary: Today's calendar includes the ADP Employment Change Weekly report and the NY Empire State Manufacturing Index. Investors are also monitoring speeches from Fed Vice Chair for Supervision Barr and FOMC Member Daly for insights into monetary policy. FOMC meeting minutes from January, which saw the federal funds rate unchanged at 3.50%-3.75%, are highly anticipated later this week.

items.headline: Earnings Season Continues with Medtronic, Constellation Energy, and Palo Alto Networks Reporting Today
items.summary: Major companies reporting earnings today, February 17, 2026, include Medtronic ($MDT), Constellation Energy ($CEG), and Palo Alto Networks ($PANW). Investors will also look ahead to Q4 results from Walmart ($WMT), DoorDash ($DASH), and Nvidia ($NVDA) later this week.

items.headline: Geopolitical Developments and Holiday-Thinned Trading Influence Markets
items.summary: Ongoing high-stakes nuclear negotiations between the United States and Iran in Geneva, coupled with an Iranian military drill and a US naval buildup, are contributing to market uncertainty. Additionally, Lunar New Year holidays across Asia have led to subdued trading volumes globally, making active exchanges susceptible to exaggerated price movements.
